subject: Management
title: The Feedback Gap
description: A quick win: understand The Feedback Gap.

hook.text: A survey found 65% of employees want more feedback. Only 14% of managers feel equipped to give it.

buildup.text: There's a massive gap between the feedback people want and what they actually receive.

discovery.text: Gallup: employees who receive regular feedback are 3.6x more likely to be engaged at work.

twist.text: Most managers avoid feedback because they fear the conversation. So everyone stays stuck.

climax.text: Feedback isn't optional. It's the primary mechanism for growth, alignment, and trust.

punchline.text: People don't fear feedback. They fear bad feedback.

quiz.question: What is the feedback gap in most organizations?
options: Employees want more feedback but managers feel unequipped to give it
Managers give too much feedback and employees feel overwhelmed
Feedback is equally valued and delivered across all organizations
